# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here's how you can do that:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)::Vector{AbstractString}
    words = split(text)
    result = String[]
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(result, line)
            line = ""
        end 
        
        line *= word * " "
    end

    # Add the last line
    push!(result, line)

    return result
end
```

An example usage would be:

```julia
print(join(wrap_string("This is a long string that needs to be wrapped. It might exceed the default text width of 10 characters."), "\n"))
```

You can customize `text_width` for wrapping different lengths of strings.
